learn.from sentence: In this paper, we propose a generic approach to learn context-sensitive convolutional filters for natural language understanding.

does not have.from sentence: In contrast to traditional CNNs, the convolution operation in our framework does not have a fixed set of filters, and thus provides the network with stronger modeling flexibility and capacity.

introduce.from sentence: Specifically, we introduce a meta network to generate a set of context-sensitive filters, conditioned on specific input sentences; these filters are adaptively applied to either the same (Section 3.2) or different (Section 3.3) text sequences.

vary.from sentence: In this manner, the learned filters vary from sentence to sentence and allow for more fine-grained feature abstraction.

propose.from sentence: In this regard, we propose a novel bidirectional filter generation mechanism to allow interactions between sentence pairs while constructing context-sensitive representations.
